Authors: Halim E., Thomas G.N., Hidayat D.R., Gea D.
Title: 'Smart healthcare' a medical record system for effective health services
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Accounting Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Halim, E., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Thomas, G.N., Faculty of Economics Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Accounting Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidayat, D.R., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gea, D., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to determine the factors faced by developers in building a medical record system in hospitals. Through the application of medical records that have good quality will affect the level of service to patients. Utilization of a good medical record management system, the orderly administration of health services becomes effective and efficient. In this research, the proposed systems are web-based and mobile application. The scope of the design evaluated is architectural design, flow chart design, data flow diagram design, database design and system interface design. The beginning of this research using exploratory method to make confirmation involving 5 doctors and nurses working in hospitals in Jakarta, and 72 road patients who are being treated. This study also involved IT consultants at the Hospital Accreditation Commission as a resource person who understood the problem of integrating the medical record system at the hospital. Data was collected through the distribution of questionnaires during the period January - April 2020. The objective of this research is to propose medical record information system that can improve input and output problems in the patient registration process, speed of service, medical record data processing and ease of tracking medical record information. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-health; Healthcare; M-health; Smart healthcare system
